intro: Delosperma calitzdorpense, commonly known as the Calitzdorp ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically blooms in spring, producing vibrant pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators. Delosperma calitzdorpense is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
